snippet: When the Whitney Museum of American Art decided to resurrect an early interactive Internet piece, the programming code no longer worked. But would updated software change the artwork?
abstract:
Decision by Whitney Museum of American Art to resurrect an early interactive Internet piece presented conundrum when its obsolete code no longer worked; incident is indicative of how digital art degrades far more rapidly than traditional visual art, and shows that demands of upkeep are much higher.       

shows that demands of upkeep are much higher.
lead_paragraph: When the Whitney Museum of American Art decided to resurrect an early interactive Internet piece, the programming code no longer worked. But would updated software change the artwork?

headline.seo: Whitney Saves Douglas Davis’s ‘First Collaborative Sentence’
headline.main: When Artworks Crash: Restorers Face Digital Test
headline.print_headline: When Artworks Crash: Restorers Face Digital Test
